personas.persona_name: US Small Retail & E-commerce - Commerce Leaders
personas.company_type: Small direct-to-consumer and omnichannel retail brands (independent chains and fast-growth DTC brands)
personas.description: Fast-growth small retailers and DTC brands focused on conversion and repeat purchase; typically single-market or regional omni-channel operations. 5-25 commerce and marketing staff. $10K-$50K annually with 1-3 month sales cycles involving 2-4 stakeholders (Head of E‑commerce, Marketing Lead, Finance/Owner). Purchase decisions are owner/exec-driven and prioritize fast time-to-value, simple integrations, and conversion lift. Best engaged via product-led trials, ROI case studies, clear pricing, and implementation playbooks.

personas.company_type: Mid-market apparel and lifestyle brands scaling DTC, wholesale, and retail channels with growing marketing and logistics teams
personas.description: Mid-market apparel brands balancing rapid DTC growth with expanding wholesale and retail partnerships. 50-200 commerce, marketing and operations staff. $100K-$350K annually with 3-6 month sales cycles involving 4-7 stakeholders (CRO/CMO, Head of DTC, Ops, Finance, IT). Buying committees evaluate omnichannel POS sync, headless storefront capability, inventory/fulfillment orchestration, and ad-audience integrations. Engage with performance case studies, migration playbooks (Hydrogen/API), and joint GTM pilots to demonstrate CAC reduction and faster international scale.

personas.company_type: Large, enterprise retail chains and global brands with extensive store footprints and complex omnichannel requirements
personas.description: Large retail enterprises needing unified online-to-store commerce, POS modernization, and global market expansion. 200-800 retail operations and ecommerce staff across regions. $500K-$2M annual contracts with 6-12 month procurement cycles involving 6-9 stakeholders (COO/CIO, Head of Retail, Procurement, Legal, IT, Merchandising). Decisions emphasize scalability, ERP/SAP integration, security/compliance, and proven enterprise SLAs. Best engaged through executive briefings, technical integrations workshops, reference site visits, and customized TCO analyses.

personas.persona_name: Global Large B2B SaaS - Platform Eng
personas.company_type: Large technology organizations and platform teams adopting headless commerce and custom storefronts using Hydrogen, APIs and embedded commerce
personas.description: Platform engineering and product teams building custom, high-performance storefronts and commerce experiences at scale. 30-150 engineering and product staff focused on commerce integrations. $250K-$1.5M multi-year deals with 6-12 month sales cycles involving 5-10 stakeholders (CTO, VP Engineering, Product, Security, Procurement, Platform Leads). Procurement focuses on extensible APIs, performance SLAs, developer experience (Polaris/Hydrogen), and long-term platform roadmaps. Engage through technical workshops, sandbox pilots, architecture reviews, and co‑development proofs-of-concept.

personas.persona_name: North America Mid-Market Wholesale - Ops Leaders
personas.company_type: Mid-market wholesale distributors and B2B manufacturers expanding digital ordering, net-terms payments, and integrated fulfillment
personas.description: Wholesale distributors and B2B sellers digitizing order workflows, net-terms payments, and multi-channel fulfillment. 30-120 sales and operations staff supporting account managers and logistics. $75K-$300K annually with 3-6 month evaluation cycles involving 3-6 stakeholders (COO/CFO, Sales Head, IT, Procurement). Committees evaluate B2B checkout, custom pricing, tax/ERP integration, and ACH/net-terms support. Best approached with B2B feature demos, ERP integration blueprints, and pilot customer success programs.

result.generation_reasoning: Five company archetypes were chosen to reflect Shopify's multi-segment GTM: small DTC retailers (fast, product-led buys), mid-market apparel (high-fit DTC growth customers), California enterprise retail (large omnichannel adopters), global platform engineering teams (headless/API-focused enterprise tech buyers), and mid-market wholesale distributors (B2B/wholesale opportunity). Tiers are balanced: two tier_1 (40%), two tier_2 (40%), one tier_3 (20%) to match strategic priority and opportunity density. Each persona uses a single industry, a standard company_size_range, 10–27 decision-maker title variations ordered by seniority, and descriptions that explicitly state team size, deal size, sales cycle, and stakeholder counts along with decision drivers and engagement approach.
